SENT.plain: Chest pain and chest wall deformities are common in children
Although most children with chest pain have a benign diagnosis, some have a serious etiology for pain, so the complaint must be addressed carefully
Unfortunately, there are few prospective studies to evaluate this complaint in children
Serious causes for chest pain are rare, making it difficult to develop clear guidelines for evaluation and management
The child who appears well, has a normal physical examination, and lacks worrisome history deserves reassurance and careful follow-up rather than extensive studies
Multicenter studies are needed to better define this important symptom
